name: AzureVmssDeployment
description: Deploy Virtual Machine scale set image
releaseNotes: - Updates Azure Virtual Machine scale set with a custom machine image.
author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: StartupConfiguration
groups.visibleRule: action = Configure application startup || action = Update image || action = UpdateImage

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the scale set.

inputs.name: action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Action to be performed on the scale set.

inputs.name: vmssName
inputs.label: Virtual Machine scale set name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of scale set. Note that image can be updated only for a scale set which is running a custom image. If a scale set is using platform/gallery image, then image update operation will fail.

inputs.name: imageUrl
inputs.label: Image url
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the URL of image VHD. If it is an Azure storage blob url, the storage account location should be same as scale set location.

inputs.name: customScriptsPath
inputs.label: Custom script directory
inputs.helpMarkDown:
path to directory containing custom script and related scripts. These scripts can be used to set start-up environment for application(if any) being deployed through custom image. In other words, application configuration management can be achieved using this script.
E.g. the script can set a machine level environment variable and the application can then consume envionment variable. This enables usage of same VHD image across multiple deployments.

inputs.name: customScriptCommand
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Command to be run to execute custom script. Arguments can also be provided in command. Release variables can be used which makes it easy to use pass secrets.
For powershell script, use something like "powershell .\<script-name>.ps1 <arguments>". For shell script use something like "bash ./<script-name>.sh <arguments>", Example usages:
1. ".\SetEnv.cmd" will set some environment variabels which will be used by application when starting.
2. "powershell .\Update-DatabaseConnectionStrings.ps1 -clusterType dev -user $(dbUser) -password $(dbUserPwd)" will update connection string in web.config of web application.
3. "bash ./install-secrets.sh --key-vault-type prod -key serviceprincipalkey" will create an encrypted file containing service principal key.

inputs.name: customScriptsStorageAccount
inputs.label: Azure storage account where custom scripts will be uploaded.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a pre-existing ARM storage account. It is used as an intermediary storage of custom scripts.
